meanings.definition: A small card or piece of microfilm containing a microphotograph of a newspaper page, catalog, or other document.
meanings.sent1: I found an old fiche with a picture of a newspaper article.
meanings.sent2: Libraries often use fiches to store old newspapers for research purposes.
meanings.sent3: The detective searched through the fiche, hoping to find a clue hidden in the microphotograph.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a fiche, storing every detail of the event.
meanings.sent5: The fiche held a tiny world of information within its small frame.

meanings.definition: To store or arrange information on microfilm in the form of fiche.
meanings.sent1: She had to fiche all the documents to keep them organized.
meanings.sent2: The archivist fiched the records meticulously for future reference.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he could fiche his whole life on those tiny cards.
meanings.sent4: The idea fiched itself in her mind, ready to be retrieved when needed.
meanings.sent5: Fiching the data made it easier to access and manage in the long run.
